a.g: O mankind, fear your Lord. Indeed, the convulsion of the [final] Hour is a terrible thing.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol4 book3
Indeed, when the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, recited the saying of the Most High: "Indeed, the earthquake of the Hour is a tremendous thing," he said: "Do you know what day this is? This is a day when it will be said to Adam, upon him be peace: 'Arise and dispatch the dispatch to the Fire from your progeny.' He will say: 'How many?' It will be said: 'From every thousand, nine hundred and ninety-nine to the Fire, and one to Paradise.'" So the people despaired [ablisa] and began to weep, and they abandoned their day from engagement and work. Then the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, came out to them and said: "What is the matter with you? Why do you not work?" They said: "And who would busy himself with work after what you have told us of this?" He said: "What is your number among the nations? Where are the people of Tawil, Thariq, Mansak, Ya'juj and Ma'juj? Nations none can enumerate except God, the Most High. You are among the rest of the nations but like a white hair on the hide of a black bull, and like a mark on the foreleg of a beast." So see how He would drive the creation with the whips of fear [khawf] and lead them with the reins of hope [raja'] to God, the Most High. For He drove them first with the whips of fear, but when that took them beyond the limit of moderation to the excess of despair [yā's], He treated them with the remedy of hope and returned them to moderation and the middle way. The latter was not a contradiction of the former, but He mentioned in the first what He saw as a cause for healing and confined Himself to it. Then, when they needed treatment with hope, He mentioned the completion of the matter.

a.g: On the Day you see it every nursing mother will be distracted from that [child] she was nursing, and every pregnant woman will abort her pregnancy, and you will see the people [appearing] intoxicated while they are not intoxicated; but the punishment of Allah is severe.
And of the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge and follows every rebellious devil.
It has been decreed for every devil that whoever turns to him - he will misguide him and will lead him to the punishment of the Blaze.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

j3 k01
Indeed, Allah the Exalted has decreed [kataba]: "Whoever takes him as an ally, he will mislead him and guide him to the punishment of the Blaze." And whoever aids Satan [ash-shaytan] through his action, then he is his ally, even if he remembers Allah [dhikr Allah] with his tongue. And if you say the hadith has come unrestricted, that remembrance repels Satan, and you do not understand that most of the general principles of the Law are specified by conditions conveyed by the scholars of religion, then look to your own soul [nafs]. For the report is not like witnessing. And reflect that the ultimate point of your remembrance and your worship is the prayer [as-salah]. So observe your heart [qalb] when you are in your prayer—how Satan pulls it towards the markets, and the accounting of worldly affairs, and the replies to opponents, and how he carries you through the valleys of the world [ad-dunya] and its perils, until you do not remember what you had forgotten of the vanities of the world except in your prayer. And Satan does not crowd upon your heart except when you pray. For the prayer is the crucible of hearts; through it their virtues and their faults become manifest. Thus, prayer is not accepted from hearts laden with the desires of the world. It is no wonder, then, that Satan is not repelled from you; rather, perhaps the whisperings increase upon you, just as medicine before taking precaution may increase the harm upon you. So if you desire deliverance from Satan, then first present the precaution of God-consciousness [at-taqwa], then follow it with the medicine of remembrance. Satan will flee from you as he fled from 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with him.

a.g: O People, if you should be in doubt about the Resurrection, then [consider that] indeed, We created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then from a clinging clot, and then from a lump of flesh, formed and unformed - that We may show you. And We settle in the wombs whom We will for a specified term, then We bring you out as a child, and then [We develop you] that you may reach your [time of] maturity. And among you is he who is taken in [early] death, and among you is he who is returned to the most decrepit [old] age so that he knows, after [once having] knowledge, nothing. And you see the earth barren, but when We send down upon it rain, it quivers and swells and grows [something] of every beautiful kind.
That is because Allah is the Truth and because He gives life to the dead and because He is over all things competent
And [that they may know] that the Hour is coming - no doubt about it - and that Allah will resurrect those in the graves.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

j2 k05
None

a.g: And of the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening book [from Him],

Twisting his neck [in arrogance] to mislead [people] from the way of Allah. For him in the world is disgrace, and We will make him taste on the Day of Resurrection the punishment of the Burning Fire [while it is said],
"That is for what your hands have put forth and because Allah is not ever unjust to [His] servants."
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol4 book10
None

a.g: And of the people is he who worships Allah on an edge. If he is touched by good, he is reassured by it; but if he is struck by trial, he turns on his face [to the other direction]. He has lost [this] world and the Hereafter. That is what is the manifest loss.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol3 book 7a
Indeed, the one who is perishing [al-hālik] rejoices in his hope [rajā'], so his worldly life [dunyāhu] remains not for him, and his religion [dīnahu] is not secured for him. "He has lost this world [al-dunyā] and the Hereafter [al-ākhirah]; that is the manifest loss [al-khusrān al-mubīn]." Oh, what a calamity, how terrible it is, and what a great disaster! So be mindful of Allah, my brothers, and let not Satan [al-shayṭān] and his allies from among men deceive you with arguments that are invalid [al-ḥujaj al-dāḥiḍah] before Allah. For they vie greedily for the world [al-dunyā], then seek excuses [al-ma'ādhīr] and arguments [al-ḥujaj] for themselves, and they claim that the Companions of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ had wealth. So the deceived ones adorn themselves with the mention of the Companions so that people may excuse them for amassing wealth. And Satan has indeed overwhelmed them, and they perceive not.

a.g: He invokes instead of Allah that which neither harms him nor benefits him. That is what is the extreme error.
He invokes one whose harm is closer than his benefit - how wretched the protector and how wretched the associate.
Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. Indeed, Allah does what He intends.

Whoever should think that Allah will not support [Prophet Muhammad] in this world and the Hereafter - let him extend a rope to the ceiling, then cut off [his breath], and let him see: will his effort remove that which enrages [him]?
And thus have We sent the Qur'an down as verses of clear evidence and because Allah guides whom He intends.

Indeed, those who have believed and those who were Jews and the Sabeans and the Christians and the Magians and those who associated with Allah - Allah will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed Allah is, over all things, Witness.

Do you not see that to Allah prostrates whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth and the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, the moving creatures and many of the people? But upon many the punishment has been justified. And he whom Allah humiliates - for him there is no bestower of honor. Indeed, Allah does what He wills.
These are two adversaries who have disputed over their Lord. But those who disbelieved will have cut out for them garments of fire. Poured upon their heads will be scalding water
By which is melted that within their bellies and [their] skins.
And for [striking] them are maces of iron.
Every time they want to get out of Hellfire from anguish, they will be returned to it, and [it will be said], "Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire!"

Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearl, and their garments therein will be silk.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol4 book10
Indeed, Allah the Exalted says: "They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearl, and their garments therein will be silk." The verses concerning this are many, and its detail is in the narrations. Indeed, Abu Hurairah reported that the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "Whoever enters Paradise enjoys bliss without misery, his garments do not wear out, and his youth does not perish. In Paradise is that which no eye has seen, no ear has heard, and has not occurred to the heart [qalb] of any human." And a man said: "O Messenger of Allah, inform us about the garments of the people of Paradise. Are they created as a creation or woven as a weaving?" The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, remained silent, and some of the people laughed. So the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Why do you laugh at an ignorant one asking a knowledgeable one?" Then the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Rather, they are split open from the fruit of Paradise, twice." And Abu Hurairah said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Indeed, the first group to enter Paradise, their form is like the form of the moon on the night of the full moon. They do not spit therein, nor blow their noses, nor defecate. Their vessels and their combs are of gold and silver, and their sweat is musk. For each one of them are two wives; the marrow of their shins is seen from behind the flesh due to their beauty. There is no discord among them and no mutual hatred; their hearts [qulub] are upon one heart [qalb]. They glorify Allah morning and evening." And in a narration: "Upon each wife are seventy garments." And he, peace be upon him, said regarding His statement, the Exalted: "They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold": "Indeed, upon them are crowns. The lowest pearl among them illuminates what is between the East and the West."
Vol4 book10

a.g: And they had been guided [in worldly life] to good speech, and they were guided to the path of the Praiseworthy.

Indeed, those who have disbelieved and avert [people] from the way of Allah and [from] al-Masjid al-Haram, which We made for the people - equal are the resident therein and one from outside; and [also] whoever intends [a deed] therein of deviation [in religion] or wrongdoing - We will make him taste of a painful punishment.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 7
Indeed, he who made this for you, so look upon his face and know him, for he is from their allies. So he said, "Do you worship Allah, O son of Marzuq?" He said, "Yes." So he was taken and brought to Baghdad. He disliked to punish him with a punishment that would be scandalous for him among the common people, so he placed him in the stable of beasts to tend the beasts. And they assigned to him a biting horse, of evil character, so that the horse might trample him. But Allah, Exalted is He, softened the horse for him. He said, "Then they made him go to a house and locked it upon him, and Al-Mahdi took the key with him. Then, after three days, he had gone out to the garden eating herbs." So Al-Mahdi was informed of him. He said to him, "Who brought you out?" He said, "The One who imprisoned me." Al-Mahdi clamored and shouted and said, "Do you not fear that I will kill you?" So Abdullah raised his head to him, laughing, and he was saying, "If you possessed power over life [hayat] or death [mawt]..." And he remained imprisoned until Al-Mahdi died, then they left him alone. So he returned to Mecca. He said, "And he had made upon himself a vow that if Allah delivered him from their hands, he would slaughter a hundred camels." So he worked upon that until he slaughtered them.

a.g: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We designated for Abraham the site of the House, [saying], "Do not associate anything with Me and purify My House for those who perform Tawaf and those who stand [in prayer] and those who bow and prostrate.
And proclaim to the people the Hajj [pilgrimage]; they will come to you on foot and on every lean camel; they will come from every distant pass -
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 7
Indeed, God, the Mighty and Majestic, has said: "And proclaim [adhina] to the people the pilgrimage [hajj]; they will come to you on foot and on every lean mount; they will come from every distant pass." And Qatadah said: When God, the Mighty and Majestic, commanded Ibrahim, peace be upon him—and upon our Prophet and upon every chosen servant—to proclaim [an yu'dhina] to the people the pilgrimage [hajj], he called out: "O people, indeed God, the Mighty and Majestic, has built a House, so perform the pilgrimage [hajj] to it."
Vol1 book 7
Indeed, God, the Mighty and Majestic, has said: "And proclaim [adhina] to the people the pilgrimage [hajj]; they will come to you on foot and on every lean mount; they will come from every distant pass." And Qatadah said: When God, the Mighty and Majestic, commanded Ibrahim, peace be upon him—and upon our Prophet and upon every chosen servant—to proclaim [an yu'dhina] to the people the pilgrimage [hajj], he called out: "O people, indeed God, the Mighty and Majestic, has built a House, so perform the pilgrimage [hajj] to it."

a.g: That they may witness benefits for themselves and mention the name of Allah on known days over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals. So eat of them and feed the miserable and poor.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 7
None

a.g: Then let them end their untidiness and fulfill their vows and perform Tawaf around the ancient House."
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 7
Seventh: That he be of worn appearance [rith al-hay'ah], disheveled [ash'ath], dust-covered [aghbar], not amassing adornment, nor inclining towards the causes of boastful pride and rivalry in abundance. For then he is recorded in the register of the arrogant [al-mutakabbirin] and the indulgent [al-mutaraffihin], and he exits from the party of the weak [al-du'afa'] and the poor [al-masakin], and specifically the righteous [al-salihin]. Indeed, He commanded dishevelment [al-sha'ath] and concealment [al-ikhtifa'], and forbade luxury [al-tana'um] and comfort [al-rafahiyyah] in the hadith of Fadalah ibn 'Ubayd. And in the hadith: "The pilgrim is but the disheveled [al-sha'ath], the dusty [al-nafath]." And Allah, the Exalted, says: "Look at the visitors of My House; they have come to Me disheveled [shu'athan], dust-covered [ghubaran], from every deep valley." And He, the Exalted, says: "Then let them complete their rites [tafathahum]." And *al-tafath* is dishevelment [al-sha'ath] and becoming dust-covered [al-ightibar], and its completion is through shaving, trimming the mustache, and cutting the nails.

a.g: That [has been commanded], and whoever honors the sacred ordinances of Allah - it is best for him in the sight of his Lord. And permitted to you are the grazing livestock, except what is recited to you. So avoid the uncleanliness of idols and avoid false statement,

Inclining [only] to Allah, not associating [anything] with Him. And he who associates with Allah - it is as though he had fallen from the sky and was snatched by the birds or the wind carried him down into a remote place.
That [is so]. And whoever honors the symbols of Allah - indeed, it is from the piety of hearts.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 7
Indeed, in the interpretation of His saying, the Most High — "That, and whoever honors the rites of Allah" — it is said that it is its beautification and its making excellent. And driving the sacrificial animal [al-hady] from the appointed place [al-miqat] is better, if it does not exhaust him nor burden him, and he should avoid haggling [al-mukas] in its purchase, for they used to be extravagant in three things and disliked haggling in them: the sacrificial animal [al-hady], the Udhiyah sacrifice [al-adhiyah], and the slave to be freed [al-raqabah]. For the best of that is its most expensive in price and its most precious to its owner. (And Ibn 'Umar narrated that 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, offered a Bactrian she-camel as a sacrifice [hady], and he was offered three hundred dinars for it, so he asked the Messenger of Allah ﷺ to sell it and buy other camels [budun] with its price, but he forbade him from that and said, "Rather, offer it.") And that is because the little that is good is better than the much that is inferior. And in three hundred dinars is the value of thirty camels [budun], and in them is a multiplication of meat, but the intended purpose [al-maqsud] is not the meat; rather, the intended purpose [al-maqsud] is the purification [tazkiyah] of the soul [al-nafs] and its cleansing from the attribute of miserliness [al-bukhl], and its adornment with the beauty of honoring [ta'zim] Allah, the Mighty and Majestic. "Their meat will not reach Allah, nor will their blood, but what reaches Him is piety [al-taqwa] from you." And that is attained by observing preciousness [al-nafasah] in the value, whether the number is many or few.

a.g: For you the animals marked for sacrifice are benefits for a specified term; then their place of sacrifice is at the ancient House.

And for all religion We have appointed a rite [of sacrifice] that they may mention the name of Allah over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals. For your god is one God, so to Him submit. And, [O Muhammad], give good tidings to the humble [before their Lord]
Who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts are fearful, and [to] the patient over what has afflicted them, and the establishers of prayer and those who spend from what We have provided them.

And the camels and cattle We have appointed for you as among the symbols of Allah; for you therein is good. So mention the name of Allah upon them when lined up [for sacrifice]; and when they are [lifeless] on their sides, then eat from them and feed the needy and the beggar. Thus have We subjected them to you that you may be grateful.

Their meat will not reach Allah, nor will their blood, but what reaches Him is piety from you. Thus have We subjected them to you that you may glorify Allah for that [to] which He has guided you; and give good tidings to the doers of good.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 4
Indeed, God the Exalted has said: "Their flesh [lahm] and their blood [dam] will never reach God, but what reaches Him is your God-consciousness [taqwa] from you." (22:37) And God-consciousness [taqwa] here is an attribute of the heart [qalb]. From this perspective, it is necessarily the case that the works of the heart [a'mal al-qalb] are, in sum, superior to the movements of the limbs [jawaarih]. Then it is necessarily the case that the intention [niyya] is among them the most superior, for it is an expression of the heart's [qalb] inclination toward the good and its will [irada] for it. Our purpose from the works of the limbs [a'mal bi al-jawaarih] is that the heart [qalb] returns to willing [irada] the good and that the inclination toward it is confirmed within it, so that it may empty itself of the desires [shahawat] of the lower world [dunya] and apply itself to remembrance [dhikr] and reflection [fikr]. Thus, by necessity, it is better in relation to the purpose, because it is firmly established in the very objective [maqsud] itself.

a.g: Indeed, Allah defends those who have believed. Indeed, Allah does not like everyone treacherous and ungrateful.
Permission [to fight] has been given to those who are being fought, because they were wronged. And indeed, Allah is competent to give them victory.

[They are] those who have been evicted from their homes without right - only because they say, "Our Lord is Allah." And were it not that Allah checks the people, some by means of others, there would have been demolished monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques in which the name of Allah is much mentioned. And Allah will surely support those who support Him. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
[And they are] those who, if We give them authority in the land, establish prayer and give zakah and enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong. And to Allah belongs the outcome of [all] matters.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 2
Indeed, He, the Exalted, said: "Those who, if We give them power in the land, establish the prayer [as-salah] and give the alms [az-zakah] and enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong." So He coupled that with the prayer [as-salah] and the alms [az-zakah] in the description of the righteous and the believers.

a.g: And if they deny you, [O Muhammad] - so, before them, did the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud deny [their prophets],
And the people of Abraham and the people of Lot
And the inhabitants of Madyan. And Moses was denied, so I prolonged enjoyment for the disbelievers; then I seized them, and how [terrible] was My reproach.
And how many a city did We destroy while it was committing wrong - so it is [now] fallen into ruin - and [how many] an abandoned well and [how many] a lofty palace.

So have they not traveled through the earth and have hearts by which to reason and ears by which to hear? For indeed, it is not eyes that are blinded, but blinded are the hearts which are within the breasts.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 1
Indeed, the means of guidance [asbab al-huda] are the Book [al-kitab], the Messengers [al-rusul], and the insights of the intellects [basa'ir al-'uqul], and they are offered freely. Nothing prevents them except envy [al-hasad], arrogance [al-kibr], love of the world [hubb al-dunya], and the causes [al-asbab] that blind the hearts [ta'ma al-qulub], even though they do not blind the sights. The Exalted has said: {For indeed, it is not the eyes that are blinded, but blinded are the hearts [al-qulub] which are within the breasts.} Among the blinding causes are familiarity [al-ulfah] and habit [al-'adah], and the love of adhering to them. From this is the expression in His saying: {Indeed, we found our fathers upon a community...} And from arrogance and envy is the expression in His saying: {And they said, "Why was this Qur'an not sent down upon a great man from one of the two cities?"} and His saying: {What! A single human being from among us that we should follow him?} These are the blinding causes [al-ma'miyat] that have prevented guidance [al-ihtida'].

a.g: And they urge you to hasten the punishment. But Allah will never fail in His promise. And indeed, a day with your Lord is like a thousand years of those which you count.
And for how many a city did I prolong enjoyment while it was committing wrong. Then I seized it, and to Me is the [final] destination.
Say, "O people, I am only to you a clear warner."
And those who have believed and done righteous deeds - for them is forgiveness and noble provision.
But the ones who strove against Our verses, [seeking] to cause failure - those are the companions of Hellfire.

And We did not send before you any messenger or prophet except that when he spoke [or recited], Satan threw into it [some misunderstanding]. But Allah abolishes that which Satan throws in; then Allah makes precise His verses. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol3 book 8a
Indeed, We did not send before you any messenger, nor prophet, nor *muhaddath* [muhaddath], meaning the truthful ones [siddiqin]. And the *muhaddath* [muhaddath] is the one who is inspired [mulham], and the one who is inspired [mulham] is he to whom is unveiled in the inner core of his heart [batin qalb] from the direction of the inward, not from the direction of the outward sensory perceptions [mahsusat].

a.g: [That is] so He may make what Satan throws in a trial for those within whose hearts is disease and those hard of heart. And indeed, the wrongdoers are in extreme dissension.

And so those who were given knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord and [therefore] believe in it, and their hearts humbly submit to it. And indeed is Allah the Guide of those who have believed to a straight path.
But those who disbelieve will not cease to be in doubt of it until the Hour comes upon them unexpectedly or there comes to them the punishment of a barren Day.
[All] sovereignty that Day is for Allah; He will judge between them. So they who believed and did righteous deeds will be in the Gardens of Pleasure.
And they who disbelieved and denied Our signs - for those there will be a humiliating punishment.
And those who emigrated for the cause of Allah and then were killed or died - Allah will surely provide for them a good provision. And indeed, it is Allah who is the best of providers.
He will surely cause them to enter an entrance with which they will be pleased, and indeed, Allah is Knowing and Forbearing.
That [is so]. And whoever responds [to injustice] with the equivalent of that with which he was harmed and then is tyrannized - Allah will surely aid him. Indeed, Allah is Pardoning and Forgiving.
That is because Allah causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night and because Allah is Hearing and Seeing.
That is because Allah is the Truth, and that which they call upon other than Him is falsehood, and because Allah is the Most High, the Grand.
Do you not see that Allah has sent down rain from the sky and the earth becomes green? Indeed, Allah is Subtle and Acquainted.
To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth. And indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

Do you not see that Allah has subjected to you whatever is on the earth and the ships which run through the sea by His command? And He restrains the sky from falling upon the earth, unless by His permission. Indeed Allah, to the people, is Kind and Merciful.
And He is the one who gave you life; then He causes you to die and then will [again] give you life. Indeed, mankind is ungrateful.

For every religion We have appointed rites which they perform. So, [O Muhammad], let the disbelievers not contend with you over the matter but invite them to your Lord. Indeed, you are upon straight guidance.
And if they dispute with you, then say, "Allah is most knowing of what you do.
Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which you used to differ."
Do you not know that Allah knows what is in the heaven and earth? Indeed, that is in a Record. Indeed that, for Allah, is easy.
And they worship besides Allah that for which He has not sent down authority and that of which they have no knowledge. And there will not be for the wrongdoers any helper.

And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, you recognize in the faces of those who disbelieve disapproval. They are almost on the verge of assaulting those who recite to them Our verses. Say, "Then shall I inform you of [what is] worse than that? [It is] the Fire which Allah has promised those who disbelieve, and wretched is the destination."

O people, an example is presented, so listen to it. Indeed, those you invoke besides Allah will never create [as much as] a fly, even if they gathered together for that purpose. And if the fly should steal away from them a [tiny] thing, they could not recover it from him. Weak are the pursuer and pursued.
They have not appraised Allah with true appraisal. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
Allah chooses from the angels messengers and from the people. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.
He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them. And to Allah will be returned [all] matters.
O you who have believed, bow and prostrate and worship your Lord and do good - that you may succeed.

And strive for Allah with the striving due to Him. He has chosen you and has not placed upon you in the religion any difficulty. [It is] the religion of your father, Abraham. Allah named you "Muslims" before [in former scriptures] and in this [revelation] that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people. So establish prayer and give zakah and hold fast to Allah. He is your protector; and excellent is the protector, and excellent is the helper.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

j2 k04
Indeed, that is hardship [haraj], and there is no hardship [haraj] in the religion: *"And He has not placed upon you in the religion any hardship [haraj]"* (22:78). And this is known by the fact that when a shield [mijann] was stolen in the time of the Messenger of God, peace be upon him—a hadith: "A shield was stolen in the time of the Messenger of God, peace be upon him"—it is agreed upon from the hadith of Ibn 'Umar that the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, cut the hand of a thief for a shield valued at three dirhams. And for one who misappropriated from the spoils [ghanima] a cloak ['aba']—a hadith: "One misappropriated from the spoils a cloak"—narrated by Al-Bukhari from the hadith of 'Abdullah ibn 'Umar, and the name of the misappropriator was Karkarah. No one refrained from purchasing shields [majan] and cloaks ['aba'] in the world [dunya]. And likewise for everything that is stolen. And thus it was known that among the people are those who trade in dirhams and dinars, and the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, and the people did not abandon dirhams and dinars completely—a hadith: "Indeed, among the people are those who trade in dirhams and dinars, and the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, and the people did not abandon dirhams completely." This is known, and the hadith of Jabir will come after it with a hadith, and it indicates that. In summary, the world [dunya] is only free from the unlawful [haram] if all creation is protected from sins, and that is impossible. And if this condition is not stipulated for the world [dunya], it is also not stipulated for a land except if it occurs among a limited group of people. Rather, avoiding this is from the scrupulousness of the obsessive [al-musawwisīn], if that is not reported from the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, nor from any of the Companions, and fulfilling it is inconceivable in any religious community [millah] from the communities [milal], nor in any era [asr] from the eras [asur].
